alert.note: Alert for Logan; Sherman; Thomas; Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 9:23PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong northerly winds will impact portions of Wallace, Thomas, northwestern Logan and southeastern Sherman Counties through 915 PM MDT/1015 PM CDT/... At 816 PM MDT/916 PM CDT/, strong northerly winds emanating from thunderstorms in Colorado were progressing southeastward into northwest Kansas, the leading edge of which was situated along a line extending from 12 miles south of McDonald to 6 miles southwest of Goodland to 11 miles northeast of Cheyenne Wells. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph and locally reduced visibilities associated with blowing dust. SOURCE...The automated observation site in Burlington, Colorado measured a 47 mph north northwesterly wind gust at 753 PM MDT. The National Weather Service in Goodland measured north northwest winds sustained at 37 mph gusting to 49 mph at 816 PM MDT. IMPACT...Hazardous travel conditions. This includes Interstate 70 from Kanorado east to Oakley. Locations impacted include... Colby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
